title: Can't Launch
body:
Hi,

I've been having problems for quite some time now with launching the game. This started to occur this season. After I press "Launch" the button goes grey and nothing happens for a while. Eventually it will launch if I'm lucky but it takes a long time, and after patches it doesn't launch at all. Reinstalling helps launch the game once but after that the same problem continues to happen. I have spent hours searching for a solution and I believe that uninstalling my AntiVirus (Bitdefender) is the only one that seems to work. However, I do not want to do this because it is actually a good AntiVirus. 

Is there a way around this problem? I have tried adding League to the Exclusions list multiple times but it never works. There has to be another solution. 

Thanks.

replies.body:
Hey there,

You said your antivirus seems to be causing this issue, have you added the entire LoL install directory (Default **C:\Riot Games\**) [to your antivirus exclusion list](http://www.bitdefender.com/support/how-do-i-exclude-a-folder-from-being-scanned-[bitdefender-windows-8-security]-1067.html), if not then try that and report back.

It's also possible that your antivirus comes bundled with a firewall which is causing you issues, see below for steps on how to add league as an exception in your firewall.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KB,realm=OCE,timestamp=2016-03-08T16:58:59.450+0000)
> **ADDING EXCEPTIONS TO YOUR FIREWALL MANUALLY:**
> Here is a list of executable paths that you will need to add to your firewall's exception list:
> 
* C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\lol.launcher.exe
* C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\system\rads_user_kernel.exe

> **Special Note:**
> 
> These next three executables may be located in different directories depending on the current version of the game. Please note that the bolded section will change with every new patch:
>  
* C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\solutions\lol_game_client_sln\releases\(latest release version - **ex: 0.0.0.xx**)\deploy\League of Legends.exe
* C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\(latest release version - **ex: 0.0.0.xx**)\deploy\LolClient.exe
* C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_launcher\releases\(latest release version - **ex: 0.0.0.xx**)\deploy\LoLLauncher.exe

> **Additional Notes:**
> 
> Unfortunately, there are many different types and versions of firewalls. It is outside the scope of this article to go into detail about how to configure each one. You may need to contact the manufacturer of your firewall in order to properly configure exceptions for League of Legends (feel free to use the list above!).
> 
> **Generally, this process requires three steps:**
> 
* Right-click on the firewall from your system tray and access Options or Settings.
* Find a tab on Exceptions\Allowances\Applications.
* Add each of the four executables above. Be sure to give them "Full Access" or the equivalent setting.

Hey Sephiroth, thanks for the reply. 

So yeah, I have already added the entire LoL folder to the exclusions list, but still no luck. Like I've seen many people say online, the exclusions just don't seem to make a difference. 

I've also added League to the exceptions in the firewall but that also seems to not work. 

It's sad, because I already thought League was automatically whitelisted by most AntiViruses yet one of the most popular ones (BitDefender) still has this problem. 

And what's weird about it is I've always had BitDefender but this problem has never occurred until this Season. 

Hopefully Riot can come up with a solution to this because I assume lots of other players with BitDefender are encountering the same problem.

> [{quoted}](name=Bytez,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=vlUwyliU,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-03-09T23:39:29.202+0000)
>
> Hey Sephiroth, thanks for the reply. 
> 
> So yeah, I have already added the entire LoL folder to the exclusions list, but still no luck. Like I've seen many people say online, the exclusions just don't seem to make a difference. 

Perhaps this is an issue with bitdefender? You should try contacting them.

> I've also added League to the exceptions in the firewall but that also seems to not work. 

Did you add it as an exception in Windows Firewall or your Antiviruses? Which do you have enabled?

> It's sad, because I already thought League was automatically whitelisted by most AntiViruses yet one of the most popular ones (BitDefender) still has this problem. 
> 
> And what's weird about it is I've always had BitDefender but this problem has never occurred until this Season. 

There was a recent issue with Avast that came up involving false detections of the league executables as malware, if your AV is detecting league as malware and you've already added it as an exception, try filing a false positive report (Most AV's should have this ability from within their software) and temporarily disabling your antivirus should you wish to play league until the issue is resolved.

Are you sure it's your antivirus causing the issue? Perhaps you should switch from BitDefender to another piece of software? Might I suggest [MalwareBytes](https://www.malwarebytes.org/).

I am 100% sure that it is my AntiVirus causing the issue. I got fed up and Uninstalled just to prove my hypothesis. The moment it was Uninstalled League booted up perfectly with no problems at all. I installed another AntiVirus just in case and I now have no problems. Since BitDefender is indeed a top tier AntiVirus it's a shame that I had to Uninstall it due to such an issue, but it's fine since I can just reinstall it when I want. 

Thanks for your replies and concern.
Good to hear all is resolved. I would still suggest contacting BitDefender yourself as stated above and reporting the false positive, if possible.

Really disappointing to see that this issue hasn't been fixed. Can't you guys at Riot email BitDefender about this issue and get something sorted?

Really don't want to have to uninstall my favourite antivirus for a second time just to play league.
